channel.title: Choosing a framework for SecureChat2
channel.description: I'm working on the next installment of SecureChat ([SecureChat2](https://github.com/spec-sec/SecureChat2)), and I'm strongly considering moving development over to Node JS. I need a database ORM and Rest API to keep track of messages, chat sessions, keys, and to authenticate users. I've been looking at [LoopBack](https://loopback.io), but I'm afraid of starting a new project on LoopBack 3 when LoopBack 4 is already in development (and v3 uses packages that have vulnerabilities). LoopBack 4, however, is not production ready and lacks widespread support. If anyone has a recommendation for a good framework to use, I'd really appreciate it!
